alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greene; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:06PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, southwestern Columbia and southeastern Greene Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1206 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woodstock, or 8 miles west of Saugerties, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Claverack, Woodstock, Livingston, Coxsackie, Clermont, Athens, Philmont, Lorenz Park, West Hurley, Saugerties South, North-South Lake Campground, Claverack-Red Mills, Veteran, Stockport, Germantown, Centerville and Tannersville. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 20 and 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Greene; Western Greene; Western Ulster
